ygData.subject: Re: Mystic Daggers and the List
ygData.msgSnippet: Therein lies your problem.  Why is it necessary for you to read all 100+ messages before class?  Why not just save some for later?  Or, just skim through them
ygData.messageBody:
Therein lies your problem. Why is it necessary for you to read all 100+
messages before class? Why not just save some for later? Or, just skim
through them and nuke the ones you don't need.

Not only am I on this list, but I'm also on the EQ_Rangers list, the
EQMagicians list, the EQRogues list, the EQMonks list, and the
EQNecromancers list (I was somewhat undecided as to which class to play at
first :) ). Let me tell you... It's downright *impossible* for me to read
all of the messages before I head to work in the morning. I just let them
stack up for later reading. Most of the time (in fact, all of the time) I
just skim the lists to pick out tidbits of information that I can use. The
rest get nuked.

And you don't really have to worry that this method will make you miss some
important messages, either. If you happen to step into the middle of a
thread, and you'd like to read the prior responses, just check the archive
at http://www.onelist.com

Nat (Not playing yet... but WILL DEFINITELY be playing a Wizard!)


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Garret Albritton <defender@...>
>
> BTW I think a news group version of this list would be a great
> idea. I like
> the list alot, but trying to read 100+ messages every morning before I
> leave for classes kind of sucks.
> Garret E. Albritton (Defender)
